reasons_to_visit.details: Murrayfield hosts Six Nations clashes with electric pub atmospheres.
Crocuses and daffodils brighten Princes Street Gardens and Inverleith Park.
Interactive exhibits pop up across the city from mid-month.
Sunset pushes past 6pm, extending sightseeing hours.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Accommodation and trains sell out on rugby weekends; plan ahead.
Rainbows, hail, and sunshine often arrive sequentially-pack layers.
Bars and restaurants near Murrayfield levy match-day pricing.

weather.precipitation: Showers broken by bright spells; snow possible on nearby hills.
weather.general_tips: Carry a compact umbrella and schedule outdoor walks for mornings when winds are calm.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate weekday footfall, surging on rugby Saturdays.
tourism_level.pricing: Standard rates except major event weekends.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Buzzing pubs and renewed energy as locals embrace spring.

events_holidays.name: Six Nations Rugby
events_holidays.description: International rugby fixtures draw fans with kilts, bagpipes, and street parties.
events_holidays.notes: Book travel early; avoid driving near Murrayfield.

events_holidays.name: St Patrick's Celebrations
events_holidays.description: Irish bars across the Old Town host live music and special menus.
events_holidays.notes: Expect crowded pubs-arrive before evening rush.

unique_experiences.description: Exclusive early access uncovers the Crown Room before general opening.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reserve the 8:45am slot; arrives with coffee and pastry.

unique_experiences.description: Spot herons and street art along a traffic-free path.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Hire bikes near Haymarket; trail can be muddy-use hybrid tires.

unique_experiences.description: Hear myths and legends told by leading raconteurs in a cozy theatre.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Purchase tickets online; family matinees available weekends.

unique_experiences.description: Spring collections arrive at designer boutiques and local makers.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Combine with afternoon tea at Harvey Nichols for skyline views.

weather.precipitation: More stable with lengthening sunny afternoons.
weather.general_tips: Layer light knitwear with waterproof shell; sunglasses useful for low spring sun.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate as shoulder season begins; student tours increase.
tourism_level.pricing: Gradual rise in hotel demand but still below summer peaks.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Optimistic and social, with beer gardens reopening on warm days.

events_holidays.name: Edinburgh International Harp Festival
events_holidays.description: Concerts and workshops celebrate Celtic harp traditions.
events_holidays.notes: Tickets available online; some sessions free.

unique_experiences.description: Panoramic views of the castle paired with Thai small plates.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reserve terrace seating and request blankets on cooler evenings.

unique_experiences.description: Explore cathedral ruins and sample local fudge doughnuts.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take train to Leuchars then shuttle bus; book Old Course tours ahead.

unique_experiences.where: Scottish National Gallery of Modern Art
unique_experiences.description: Thursday lates combine contemporary art with live DJs.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry; cafe offers seasonal Scottish plates.

unique_experiences.description: Guided walks identify wild garlic, nettles, and edible blossoms.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear waterproof boots; tours proceed in light rain.
